block.p: Debra Karen Gordon, the daughter of Ruth G. Gordon of Baltimore and Dr. Albert M. Gordon of Annapolis, Md., was married last evening to Jeremy Daniel Sollinger, a son of Elizabeth Sollinger and Dr. Irwin D. Sollinger of Westport, Conn. Rabbi Deborah A. Hirsch officiated at the home of the bridegroom's parents.

Mrs. Sollinger, 31, is a senior development executive for the UJA-Federation of New York. She graduated from the University of Texas at Austin and is a candidate for a master's degree in social work from Yeshiva University. Her father, a pediatrician, has a private practice in Annapolis.

Debra Karen Gordon, the daughter of Ruth G. Gordon of Baltimore and Dr. Albert M. Gordon of Annapolis, Md., was married last evening to Jeremy Daniel Sollinger, a son of Elizabeth Sollinger and Dr. Irwin D. Sollinger of Westport, Conn. Rabbi Deborah A. Hirsch officiated at the home of the bridegroom's parents.

Mrs. Sollinger, 31, is a senior development executive for the UJA-Federation of New York. She graduated from the University of Texas at Austin and is a candidate for a master's degree in social work from Yeshiva University. Her father, a pediatrician, has a private practice in Annapolis.

Mr. Sollinger, 29, is the associate director of Camp Laurel, a residential summer camp for children in Readfield, Me. He graduated cum laude from Union College in Schenectady, N.Y. His father, a clinical psychologist, practices in Westport.
